Metadata: Pacific salmon aquaculture program: incubation and cultivation phases
Ocean Systems Inc., U of Washington Sea Grant

This is the final report of a Sea Grant project to demonstrate the feasibility of raising marketable pan-size salmon on a commercial scale in Puget Sound, Washington. 8 total of 2l I, 000 salmon were successfully raised from eggs to an average marketable 12-inch size (approximately 340 grams) in fourteen months using floating net pens. The following phases of the operation are described in this report: l. Incubation of eggs 2. Freshwater cultivation in ponds 3. Saltwater cultivation in net pens 4. Stimulation of public awareness 5. Environmental monitoring.
